name: Feedback Receive/Send
description:
These two algorithms are taken together as they form a mechanism to introduce feedback into presets. Though perhaps misnamed â€“ they can just as easily feed forward. Think of them as two ends of a teleport/hyperspace tunnel: what goes in one end (the send) comes out the other (the receive). If the receive is placed above the send in the preset, you have feedback; if placed after the send, it acts as a way to teleport busses past a section of the preset.

Both algorithms share an 'Identifier' parameter to match up send/receive pairs when multiple exist. The number of channels processed depends on specifications (1-8). If channel counts mismatch, only the smaller number is processed.

**Warning:** Be cautious with feedback loops; the receive's gain defaults to -40dB (silent) for safety.
use_cases: Teleporting audio busses across sections of a preset
Matching send/receive pairs for modular routing
Signal rerouting in complex patch structures
gui_description: Two distinct modules (Receive/Send) with shared identifier parameter. Channel-specific controls include input/output selection, gain adjustment, and enable/disable toggles.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: An identifier to match up the receive with a send (or vice versa) when multiple pairs exist.

input_ports.name: Signal Input (Receive)
input_ports.description: Audio/CV signal input for the receive module, routed from a corresponding send.

input_ports.name: Channel Inputs
input_ports.description: Per-channel inputs for the send module, sourced from specified busses.

output_ports.name: Signal Output (Receive)
output_ports.description: Audio/CV signal output routed to a specified bus after gain processing.

output_ports.name: Output Bus
output_ports.description: The selected bus where the received or sent signal is directed.
